When I was in my early or mid teens, sometime in the first decade of the 2000s, while visiting DC I met someone at the national mall handing out papers to raise awareness about falun gong persecution in China. Never heard much about it since then. Nobody cares anyway, because China makes everything we buy so what would people do, say 'oh well sucks for them' and then go get Chinese junk from Walmart.... same thing with the Uighurs in Xinjiang, even if more people were aware what would change, probably not much... because of the economic realities China can't be sanctioned like Russia or Iran because they sell us so much stuff, and they're too militarily powerful to push around now, I don't see much leverage the USA has on the ccp... if they want to harvest organs from political prisoners or colonize Xinjiang and Tibet or build bases on the spratlys or conduct espionage and cyber attacks, what's the USA going to do?
